parameters: \pop[2]While \c[23]The System\c[0] is presented as mandatory, some people still dodge it.
\pop[2]They have no score, no identity, and live outside of the city in self-sustaining colonies.
\pop[2]They're known as \c[10]zeros\c[0]. While originally a small group, they have since grown quite large.
\pop[2]But as they grow, so to does the size and scope of our cities.
\pop[2]The \c[23]Argus Corporation\c[0] has slowly but surely been encroaching on \c[10]zero\c[0] territory.
\pop[2]They're running out of space, and the integrity of their communities is more and more at risk.
\pop[2]Some people say that they deserve it, but I don't think it's so black and white.
\pop[2]Either way, these protests aren't violent; and they aren't calling for any substantial change.
\pop[2]\c[10]Zeros\c[0] simply want the ability to enter the city legally, and purchase what they need to live.
\pop[2]They need this because the loss of space means they can't make enough on their own.
\pop[2]And not only that, but many people who live outside the city don't do so by choice.
\pop[2]If you abandoned \c[23]The System\c[0], you wouldn't be allowed back. Or your children. Or even \c[14]their\c[0] children.
\pop[2]Many \c[10]zeros\c[0] suffer for the choices of those that came before them.
\pop[2]These protests could give them the chance to try their hands at life in the city.
\pop[2]I'm sure they'll reach a mutual conclusion, but it's odd how involved \c[23]Argus\c[0] is...
\pop[2]They have such a sway with world powers. But I guess, as people say, they did "save the world".
\pop[2]Maybe they're simply collecting what they now believe is their reward.
\pop[2]The inner workings of the corporation are shrouded in mystery.
\pop[2]Nobody even knows who runs it, but theories run rampant.
\pop[2]Currently, it must be in the hands of the founders' child, or children.
\pop[2]It's been way too long to remain in the hands of just one generation.
\pop[2]But no matter who runs it, their influence on society is clear.
\pop[2]A world without the \c[23]Argus Corporation\c[0] would be awful.
\pop[2]At least, that's what we think. All we can really do is speculate.
\pop[2]Either way, the influence and power of this single corporation is immense.
\pop[2]They have a monopoly on almost everything, and use it to maintain order.
\pop[2]Could be worse. They could use their power for nefarious purposes.
\pop[2]Not worth thinking about though, as there are far more real issues at hand.
\pop[2]Namely, the protests and the people living outside our city limits. \c[10]Zeros\c[0].
